protocol_name: Complete Sample Protocol for Measuring IC50 of Inhibitor PD168393 in A431 Cells Responding to Epidermal Growth Factor
protocol_name_html: Complete Sample Protocol for Measuring IC50 of Inhibitor PD168393 in A431 Cells Responding to Epidermal Growth Factor
description:
Developed for:

 

Aerius,
Odyssey® Classic,

Odyssey CLx, and

Odyssey Sa
Infrared Imaging Systems
guidelines:
Required Reagents

LI-COR Reagents

  • IRDye® 800CW Goat anti-Mouse Secondary Antibody (LI-COR P/N 925-32210 or 926-32210)

  • IRDye 680RD Goat anti-Rabbit Secondary Antibody (LI-COR P/N 925-68071 or 926-68071)

  • Odyssey® Blocking Buffer (LI-COR P/N 927-40000 or 927-50000)

 

Additional Reagents

  • 1X PBS wash buffer

  • Tissue culture reagents (serum, DMEM, trypsin, 1X PBS)

  • Epidermal Growth Factor (Millipore, P/N 01-107)

  • Protein Tyrosine Kinase Inhibitor PD168393 (CALBIOCHEM®, P/N 513033)

  • Primary antibodies

  • 20% Tween® 20

  • 37% formaldehyde

  • 10% Triton® X-100

  • Clear or black 96-well or 384-well microplates (See IX. Experimental Considerations)

SPECIAL NOTE: Anti-phosphorylated-EGFR and anti-phosphorylated-ERK antibodies are purchased from Cell Signaling Technology and Santa Cruz Biotechnology, respectively. Cell starvation is needed to obtain maximal response when these two phospho-antibodies are used. This is in contrast to use of anti-phospho-ERK from BD Pharmingen and from Cell Signaling Technology.
 
 
 
 
 
 Experimental Considerations
 

Proper selection of microplates can significantly affect the results, as each plate has its own characteristics, including well depth, plate autofluorescence, and well-to-well signal crossover. Use the following general considerations for microplate selection.

 

  • In-Cell Western analyses use detection at the well surface with minimal liquid present. This results in minimal well-to-well signal spread, allowing the use of both clear as well as black-sided plates with clear bottoms. Do not use plates with white walls, since autofluorescence from the white surface will create significant noise.

  • In-Cell Western assays require sterile plates for tissue culture growth. The following plates are recommended by LI-COR Biosciences:

                   96-well format, Eppendorf (P/Ns 0030730119 or 0030741030)

                   96-well, clear, Nunc® (P/Ns 167008, 161093)
                   96-well, clear, FalconTM (P/Ns 353075, 353948)
                   96-well, black with clear bottom, Nunc (P/N 165305)

                   96-well format, Corning (P/N 3603)

 

                  384-well, clear, Nunc (P/Ns 164688, 164730)

                  384-well, clear, Falcon (P/Ns 353229, 353289)

                  384-well, black with clear bottom, Nunc (P/N 142761)

                  384-well format, Corning (P/N 3712)

 

  • Focus Offset Optimization – If plates other than those recommended are used, the focus offset can be determined empirically by scanning a plate containing experimental and control samples using the following focus offset settings.
Instrument Focus Offset Determination (mm)

Odyssey Classic & Odyssey CLx

1.0, 1.5, 2.0, 2.5, 3.0, 3.5, & 4.0

Odyssey Sa & Aerius

1.5, 2.0, 2.5, 3.0 & 3.95

 

Use the same intensity settings for each scan. After reviewing the scans, use the focus offset with the highest signal-to-noise ratio for experiments. The actual minimum and maximum focus offset will vary with each instrument. Alternatively, the plate manufacturer can be consulted to obtain the measured distance from the skirt bottom to the bottom of the plate.

 

  • All Aerius and Odyssey® Imaging systems (excluding Odyssey Fc) require microplates that have a maximum 4.0 mm distance from the base of the microplate to the target detection area of the plate (actual maximum focus offset varies with each Aerius and Odyssey Sa instrument and is found by choosing Settings > System Administration, then clicking Scanner Information). When using plates specified for In-Cell Western assays, the recommended focus offset is 3.5 mm or higher.
  • Intensity Setting Optimization -

 

 

 

Instrument

Initial

Intensity

Setting

(700/800 nm)

Intensity

Settings:

Weak Signal

(700/800 nm)

Intensity

Settings:

Saturated Signal

(700/800 nm)

Odyssey® Classic

5 / 5

 7.5 / 7.5 2.5 / 2.5

Odyssey CLx

5 / 5

 7.5 / 7.5 2.5 / 2.5
 

AutoScan*

 - -

Odyssey Sa

 7 / 7 8 / 8 4 / 4

Aerius

 7 / 7  8 / 8 4 / 4

 

*The Odyssey CLx AutoScan function alleviates the need to scan the plate at multiple intensity settings.

 

  • Protect plates from light before imaging to ensure highest sensitivity. When storing plates after imaging, the plates should remain protected from light at 4 °C.

 

Experimental Results

components.data: Allow A431 cell growth in a T75 flask using standard tissue culture procedures until cells reach near confluency (~1.5 x 107 cells; DMEM, 10% FBS; Gibco®).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Allow A431 cell growth in a T75 flask using standard tissue culture procedures until cells reach near confluency (~1.5 x 107 cells; DMEM, 10% FBS; Gibco®).

components.data: Remove growth media, wash cells with sterile 1X PBS, and trypsinize cells for displacement.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove growth media, wash cells with sterile 1X PBS, and trypsinize cells for displacement.

components.data: Neutralize displaced cells with culture media and clarify by centrifugation.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Neutralize displaced cells with culture media and clarify by centrifugation.

components.data:
Remove supernatant and disrupt the cell pellet manually by hand-tapping the collection tube.
To maintain cell integrity, do not pipet or vortex during pellet disruption.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Remove supernatant and disrupt the cell pellet manually by hand-tapping the collection tube.
To maintain cell integrity, do not pipet or vortex during pellet disruption.

components.data: Resuspend cells in 20 mL of complete media and count cells using a hemocytometer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Resuspend cells in 20 mL of complete media and count cells using a hemocytometer.

components.data: Dilute cells with complete media to achieve concentration of 200,000 cells/mL.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dilute cells with complete media to achieve concentration of 200,000 cells/mL.

components.data: Manually mix the cell suspension thoroughly.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Manually mix the cell suspension thoroughly.

components.data: Under sterile conditions, dispense 50 μL of the cell suspension per well in Falcon 384-well microplate. 10,000 cells plated per well.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Under sterile conditions, dispense 50 μL of the cell suspension per well in Falcon 384-well microplate. 10,000 cells plated per well.

components.data: Incubate cells and monitor cell density until confluency is achieved with well-to-well consistency (approximately three days).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate cells and monitor cell density until confluency is achieved with well-to-well consistency (approximately three days).

components.data: Warm serum-free media (DMEM, Gibco®) to 37 °C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Warm serum-free media (DMEM, Gibco®) to 37 °C.

components.data: Remove complete media from the microwell plate by aspiration or manual displacement.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove complete media from the microwell plate by aspiration or manual displacement.

components.data: Carefully replace media with 50 μL of pre-warmed, serum-free media per well, and incubate 4 to 16 hours.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Carefully replace media with 50 μL of pre-warmed, serum-free media per well, and incubate 4 to 16 hours.

components.data: Warm serum-free media (DMEM; Gibco) to 37 °C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Warm serum-free media (DMEM; Gibco) to 37 °C.

components.data:
• Dissolve PD168393 in DMEM to make 3 μM stock.
  • Make two-fold serial dilutions of inhibitor using DMEM so that the final concentration of inhibitor range from 3 μM to 90 pM, as shown in 'Experimental Results' (see guidelines).
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
• Dissolve PD168393 in DMEM to make 3 μM stock.
  • Make two-fold serial dilutions of inhibitor using DMEM so that the final concentration of inhibitor range from 3 μM to 90 pM, as shown in 'Experimental Results' (see guidelines).

components.data: Remove media in A431 cell plate.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove media in A431 cell plate.

components.data: Add 50 μL of serial diluted inhibitor into cells and incubate 1 to 2 hours.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 50 μL of serial diluted inhibitor into cells and incubate 1 to 2 hours.

components.data: Remove inhibitor from plate wells by aspiration or manual displacement.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove inhibitor from plate wells by aspiration or manual displacement.

components.data:
• Add either serum-free media for resting cells (mock) or serum-free media with 100 ng/mL EGF.
  • Use 50 μL of resting/activation media per well.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
• Add either serum-free media for resting cells (mock) or serum-free media with 100 ng/mL EGF.
  • Use 50 μL of resting/activation media per well.

components.data: Allow incubation at 37 °C for 7.5 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Allow incubation at 37 °C for 7.5 minutes.

components.data: Remove activation or stimulation media manually or by aspiration. Immediately fix cells with 4% formaldehyde in 1X PBS for 20 minutes at room temperature. Detailed in steps 21-23
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove activation or stimulation media manually or by aspiration. Immediately fix cells with 4% formaldehyde in 1X PBS for 20 minutes at room temperature. Detailed in steps 21-23

components.data: Prepare fresh Fixing Solution as follows:
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare fresh Fixing Solution as follows:

components.data: Using a multi-channel pipettor, add 150μL of fresh Fixing Solution (room temperature solution, RT). Add the solution by pipetting down the sides of the wells carefully to avoid detaching the cells from the well bottom.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Using a multi-channel pipettor, add 150μL of fresh Fixing Solution (room temperature solution, RT). Add the solution by pipetting down the sides of the wells carefully to avoid detaching the cells from the well bottom.

components.data: Allow incubation on bench top for 20 minutes at RT with no shaking.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Allow incubation on bench top for 20 minutes at RT with no shaking.

components.data: Wash 5 times with 1X PBS containing 0.1% Triton® X-100 (cell permeabilization) for 5 minutes per wash. Detailed in steps 25-41.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash 5 times with 1X PBS containing 0.1% Triton® X-100 (cell permeabilization) for 5 minutes per wash. Detailed in steps 25-41.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 42 of Complete Sample Protocol for Measuring IC50 of Inhibitor PD168393 in A431 Cells Responding to Epidermal Growth Factor
source_data.protocol_name: Complete Sample Protocol for Measuring IC50 of Inhibitor PD168393 in A431 Cells Responding to Epidermal Growth Factor
source_data.protocol_name_html: Complete Sample Protocol for Measuring IC50 of Inhibitor PD168393 in A431 Cells Responding to Epidermal Growth Factor
source_data.annotation: No single blocking reagent will be optimal for every antigen-antibody pair. Some primary antibodies may exhibit greatly reduced signal or different non-specific binding in different blocking solutions. If you have difficulty detecting your target protein, changing the blocking solution may dramatically improve performance. If the primary antibody has worked well in the past using chemiluminescent detection, try that blocking solution for infrared fluorescent detection.
source_data.thread_text: No single blocking reagent will be optimal for every antigen-antibody pair. Some primary antibodies may exhibit greatly reduced signal or different non-specific binding in different blocking solutions. If you have difficulty detecting your target protein, changing the blocking solution may dramatically improve performance. If the primary antibody has worked well in the past using chemiluminescent detection, try that blocking solution for infrared fluorescent detection.
source_data.body: No single blocking reagent will be optimal for every antigen-antibody pair. Some primary antibodies may exhibit greatly reduced signal or different non-specific binding in different blocking solutions. If you have difficulty detecting your target protein, changing the blocking solution may dramatically improve performance. If the primary antibody has worked well in the past using chemiluminescent detection, try that blocking solution for infrared fluorescent detection.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 42 of Complete Sample Protocol for Measuring IC50 of Inhibitor PD168393 in A431 Cells Responding to Epidermal Growth Factor
source_data.protocol_name: Complete Sample Protocol for Measuring IC50 of Inhibitor PD168393 in A431 Cells Responding to Epidermal Growth Factor
source_data.protocol_name_html: Complete Sample Protocol for Measuring IC50 of Inhibitor PD168393 in A431 Cells Responding to Epidermal Growth Factor
source_data.annotation: Odyssey Blocking Buffer often yields higher and more consistent sensitivity and performance than other blockers. Nonfat dry milk or casein dissolved in PBS can also be used for blocking and antibody dilution. Milk-based reagents can interfere with detection when using anti-goat antibodies. They also deteriorate rapidly at 4 °C, so diluted antibodies cannot be kept and reused for more than a few days. If using casein, a 0.1% solution in 0.2X PBS buffer is recommended (Hammarstengrade casein is not required).
source_data.thread_text: Odyssey Blocking Buffer often yields higher and more consistent sensitivity and performance than other blockers. Nonfat dry milk or casein dissolved in PBS can also be used for blocking and antibody dilution. Milk-based reagents can interfere with detection when using anti-goat antibodies. They also deteriorate rapidly at 4 °C, so diluted antibodies cannot be kept and reused for more than a few days. If using casein, a 0.1% solution in 0.2X PBS buffer is recommended (Hammarstengrade casein is not required).
source_data.body: Odyssey Blocking Buffer often yields higher and more consistent sensitivity and performance than other blockers. Nonfat dry milk or casein dissolved in PBS can also be used for blocking and antibody dilution. Milk-based reagents can interfere with detection when using anti-goat antibodies. They also deteriorate rapidly at 4 °C, so diluted antibodies cannot be kept and reused for more than a few days. If using casein, a 0.1% solution in 0.2X PBS buffer is recommended (Hammarstengrade casein is not required).

source_data.annotation: Blocking solutions containing BSA can be used, but in some cases may cause high membrane background. BSA-containing blockers are not generally recommended and should be used only when the primary antibody requires BSA as blocker.
source_data.thread_text: Blocking solutions containing BSA can be used, but in some cases may cause high membrane background. BSA-containing blockers are not generally recommended and should be used only when the primary antibody requires BSA as blocker.
source_data.body: Blocking solutions containing BSA can be used, but in some cases may cause high membrane background. BSA-containing blockers are not generally recommended and should be used only when the primary antibody requires BSA as blocker.

components.data: Allow blocking for 90 minutes at RT with moderate shaking on a plate shaker.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Allow blocking for 90 minutes at RT with moderate shaking on a plate shaker.

components.data:
Add the two primary antibodies into a tube containing Odyssey® Blocking Buffer. Choose one of the following primary antibody pairs:

 

  • Phospho-EGFR Tyr1045 (Rabbit; 1:100 dilution; Cell Signaling Technology, P/N 2237) | Total EGFR (Mouse; 1:500 dilution; Biosource International, P/N AHR5062)
  • Phospho-EGFR Tyr1045 (Rabbit; 1:100 dilution; Cell Signaling Technology, P/N 2237) | Total ERK2 (Mouse; 1:75 dilution; Santa Cruz Biotechnology, P/N SC-1647)
  • Phospho-ERK (Mouse; 1:100 dilution; Santa Cruz Biotechnology, P/N SC-7383) | Total ERK1 (Rabbit; 1:200 dilution; Santa Cruz Biotechnology, P/N SC-94)
  • Phospho-EGFR Tyr1045 (Rabbit; 1:100 dilution; Cell Signaling Technology, P/N 2237) | Phospho-ERK (Mouse; 1:100 dilution; Santa Cruz Biotechnology, P/N SC-7383)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Add the two primary antibodies into a tube containing Odyssey® Blocking Buffer. Choose one of the following primary antibody pairs:

 

  • Phospho-EGFR Tyr1045 (Rabbit; 1:100 dilution; Cell Signaling Technology, P/N 2237) | Total EGFR (Mouse; 1:500 dilution; Biosource International, P/N AHR5062)
  • Phospho-EGFR Tyr1045 (Rabbit; 1:100 dilution; Cell Signaling Technology, P/N 2237) | Total ERK2 (Mouse; 1:75 dilution; Santa Cruz Biotechnology, P/N SC-1647)
  • Phospho-ERK (Mouse; 1:100 dilution; Santa Cruz Biotechnology, P/N SC-7383) | Total ERK1 (Rabbit; 1:200 dilution; Santa Cruz Biotechnology, P/N SC-94)
  • Phospho-EGFR Tyr1045 (Rabbit; 1:100 dilution; Cell Signaling Technology, P/N 2237) | Phospho-ERK (Mouse; 1:100 dilution; Santa Cruz Biotechnology, P/N SC-7383)

components.data: Mix the primary antibody solution thoroughly before adding to wells.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix the primary antibody solution thoroughly before adding to wells.

components.data: Remove the blocking buffer from the blocking step and add 20 µL of the desired primary antibody or antibodies in Odyssey Blocking Buffer to cover the bottom of each well.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the blocking buffer from the blocking step and add 20 µL of the desired primary antibody or antibodies in Odyssey Blocking Buffer to cover the bottom of each well.

components.data:
• Make sure to include control wells without primary antibody to serve as a source for background well intensity.
  • Add 50 µL of Odyssey Blocking Buffer only to control wells.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
• Make sure to include control wells without primary antibody to serve as a source for background well intensity.
  • Add 50 µL of Odyssey Blocking Buffer only to control wells.

components.data: Incubate with primary antibody overnight with gentle shaking at RT.
components.name: Description

components.data:
Dilute the fluorescently-labeled secondary antibody in Odyssey® Blocking Buffer as specified below. To lower background, add Tween® 20 to the diluted antibody for a final concentration of 0.2%.

 

  • IRDye® 680RD Goat anti-Rabbit (1:800 dilution)
  • IRDye 800CW Goat anti-Mouse (1:800 dilution)

 

Or:

 

  • IRDye 680RD Goat anti-Mouse (1:800 dilution)
  • IRDye 800CW Goat anti-Rabbit (1:800 dilution)

components.data: Mix the antibody solutions thoroughly and add 20 µL of the secondary antibody solution to each well.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix the antibody solutions thoroughly and add 20 µL of the secondary antibody solution to each well.

components.data: Incubate for 60 minutes with gentle shaking at RT. Protect plate from light during incubation.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate for 60 minutes with gentle shaking at RT. Protect plate from light during incubation.

components.data: Wash the plate 5 times with 1X PBS + 0.1% Tween 20 for 5 minutes at RT with gentle shaking, using a generous amount of buffer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the plate 5 times with 1X PBS + 0.1% Tween 20 for 5 minutes at RT with gentle shaking, using a generous amount of buffer.

components.data: Using a multi-channel pipettor, add 200 µL of Tween Washing Solution at RT (Primary Antibodies, step 50). Make sure to add solution down the sides of the wells carefully to avoid detaching the cells from the well bottom. (wash 1/5)

components.data: For best results, scan plate immediately; plates may also be stored at 4 °C up to several weeks (protected from light).

components.data: Before scanning, clean the bottom plate surface and the Odyssey Infrared Imager scanning bed (if applicable) with moist, lint-free paper to avoid obstructions during scanning.

components.data: After final wash, remove wash solution completely from wells. Turn the plate upside down and tap or blot gently on paper towels to remove traces of wash buffer.
